body:
Sorry for the title guys, but it's been driving me INSANE;
Could someone reply on how or where i could make one of those nice looking moving/animated gaming intros?
Would be extremely appreciated!
Thanks - OPTOBAT
body_tagged:
Sorry for the title guys, but it's been driving me INSANE;
Could someone reply on how or where i could make one of those nice looking moving/animated gaming intros?
Would be extremely appreciated!
Thanks - OPTOBAT
title: How do you make a gaming intro? Please!

replies.body:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=knPmsk2_EQM
I used this. Check his channel for others
replies.body_tagged:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=knPmsk2_EQM
I used this. Check his channel for others

replies.body: I would recommend checking out some intro templates made by either "Velosofy", or CaptivaLP. They are both very skilled, and they make Minecraft intros as well as other types of gaming intros.
replies.body_tagged: I would recommend checking out some intro templates made by either "Velosofy", or CaptivaLP. They are both very skilled, and they make Minecraft intros as well as other types of gaming intros.

replies.body: Actually, I just screen recorded an iTunes visualizer and added text over that in iMovie. Worked pretty well in my opinion. xD
replies.body_tagged: Actually, I just screen recorded an iTunes visualizer and added text over that in iMovie. Worked pretty well in my opinion. xD

replies.body:
Alright, so, if your going to download a template, it's going to be bad I can tell you, because alot of other people would be using it also, making it show that you just downloaded one. IF you legit want to make one yourself, you sortof want to get well known with either Cinema4D/Blender/Maya (C4D is best for beginners, but takes longer to download, Blender is good but takes longer, and Maya is for professionals.) If you want a 3d banner, use those, and if you want a 2d banner, either use photshop (Make sure to use the video frame layer) or adobe after effects (Really easy to understand, and learn.) These are mainly for 2D banners. Just get well known with them, and then you want to make an intro. It's best that you learn and then do, not just try off the bat, because I've been thru that, and I've suffered thru my learning time.
NOTE: These are for minecraft intros and/or some other games that might work. I am not sure what program would be best for other intros.
replies.body_tagged:

replies.body:
1. Download one and use YouTube editor to add it to future videos. (Not recommended)
2. Windows Movie Maker or iMovie, then upload as "my new intro" then add it using YT Vid Editor. I would use short gameplay clips and then your name or something showing. (Good idea)
3. What other people said.

2. Windows Movie Maker or iMovie, then upload as "my new intro" then add it using YT Vid Editor. I would use short gameplay clips and then your name or something showing. (Good idea)
3. What other people said.

I will probably try and go with a 3-D one, like Blender or something, so thanks for the help :D
